definitions.definition: Indicating position or location.

subdefinitions.definition: Positioned at the upper surface of, touching from above .
examples: A vase of flowers stood on the table.
Please lie down on the couch.
The parrot was sitting on Jim's shoulder.

subdefinitions.definition: Positioned at or resting against the outer surface of; attached to.
examples: He had a scar on the side of his face.
There is a dirty smudge on this window.
The painting hangs on the wall.
The fruit ripened on the trees.
Should there be an accent on the "e"?
He wore old shoes on his feet.

subdefinitions.definition: At or in (a geographical location or position).
Near; adjacent to; alongside; just off.
examples: The fleet is on the American coast.
Croton -on- Hudson , Rostov -on- Don , Southend -on- Sea

subdefinitions.definition: Aboard (a mode of transport, especially public transport, or transport that one sits astride or uses while standing).
( nautical ) In the direction of (some part of one's vessel), to within 45 degrees.
examples: A ship was sighted on the port quarter .
port
quarter
on the bow ; on the starboard beam
bow
starboard
beam

definitions.definition: Expressing figurative placement, burden, or attachment.
examples: All of the responsibility is on him.
I put a bet on the winning horse.

definitions.definition: Denoting physical contact or interaction with an object, such as impact or application of force.

subdefinitions.definition: With verbs describing an action of pushing, pulling, pressing, etc., designates the thing to which force is applied.
With verbs describing an action of hitting, rubbing, scratching, binding against, etc., designates the thing impacted or contacted.
examples: I stubbed my toe on an old tree stump.
I caught my fingernail on the door handle.
The rope snagged on a branch.

subdefinitions.definition: Denoting performance or action by contact with the surface, upper part, or outside of anything ; hence, by means of; with.
examples: to play on a violin or piano

definitions.definition: Supported by (the specified part of itself).
examples: A table can't stand on two legs.
After resting on his elbows, he stood on his toes, then walked on his heels.

definitions.definition: ( UK ) At (a certain value or level).
examples: The Tories are on twenty-five percent in this constituency.
The blue team are on six points and the red team on five.

definitions.definition: At (a certain position within a sequence).
examples: I'm on question four.

definitions.definition: At or during the date or day of.
examples: Born on the 4th of July.
On Sunday I'm busy. I'll see you on Monday.
Can I see you on a different day?

definitions.definition: ( UK , especially in sports reporting ) At (a given time after the start of something).
examples: Smith scored again on twelve minutes, doubling Mudchester Rovers' lead.

definitions.definition: At (an instant or cusp).
examples: on the stroke of midnight; on the "B" of "Bang!"
on the point of leaving; on the verge of giving up

definitions.definition: Dealing with the subject of; about ; concerning .
examples: I was reading a book on history.
The city hosted the World Summit on the Information Society
I have no opinion on this subject.

definitions.definition: Indicating a means or medium.
examples: I saw it on television.
Can't you see I'm on the phone?
My favorite shows are on BBC America.
The Beatles' appearance on the Ed Sullivan Show is on YouTube.
Ed Sullivan Show
The film was released on DVD.
I'll pay on card.
He travelled on false documents.

definitions.definition: Indicating the target of, or thing affected by, an event or action.
examples: They planned an attack on London.
The soldiers mutinied and turned their guns on their officers.
Her words made a lasting impression on my mind.
What will be the effect on morale?

definitions.definition: ( informal ) In the possession of.
examples: I haven't got any money on me.

definitions.definition: Because of; due to; upon the basis of (something not yet confirmed as true).
examples: to arrest someone on suspicion of bribery
to contact someone on a hunch

definitions.definition: ( also often ' upon ' ) At the time of (and often because of).
examples: On Jack's entry, William got up to leave.
On the addition of ammonia, a chemical reaction begins.

definitions.definition: ( also often ' upon ' ) Arrived or coming into the presence of.
examples: I need to get my planting done, as the season will soon be on us.
Before we knew it, the forest was on us, and the air grew colder and damper.

definitions.definition: Paid for by.
examples: The drinks are on me tonight, boys.
The meal is on the house.
I paid for the airfare and meals for my family, but the hotel room was on the company.

definitions.definition: Toward; for; indicating the object of an emotion .
examples: Have pity or compassion on him.

definitions.definition: ( especially Ireland ) Indicating the person experiencing an emotion, cold, thirst, hunger, etc.
examples: I had a terrible thirst on me.

definitions.definition: Indicating a means of subsistence or sustenance.
examples: They lived on ten dollars a week.
The dog survived three weeks on rainwater.

definitions.definition: Engaged in or occupied with (an action or activity).
examples: He's on his lunch break.
I'm on nights all this week.
on vacation; on holiday; on a mission; on the job ; on the fiddle

definitions.definition: Regularly taking (a drug).
examples: You've been on these antidepressants far too long.

definitions.definition: Under the influence of (a drug, or something that is causing drug-like effects).
examples: He's acting crazy because he's on crack right now.

definitions.definition: In addition to; besides; indicating multiplication or succession in a series.
examples: heaps on heaps of food
mischief on mischief; loss on loss

definitions.definition: Indicating dependence or reliance .
examples: I depended on them for assistance.
He will promise on certain conditions.

definitions.definition: Serving as a member of.
examples: He is on the jury; I am on the committee.

definitions.definition: By virtue of; with the pledge of.
examples: He affirmed or promised on his word, or on his honour.

subdefinitions.definition: ( informal , chiefly in set phrases ) Ellipsis of I swear on : on my life , on God , on everything, etc.

definitions.definition: To the account or detriment of; denoting imprecation or invocation, or coming to, falling, or resting upon.
examples: On us be all the blame.
A curse on him!
Please don't tell on her and get her in trouble.
He turned on her and has been her enemy ever since.
He went all honest on me, making me listen to his confession.

definitions.definition: ( especially when numbers of combatants or competitors are specified ) Against; in opposition to.
examples: The fight was three on one, and he never stood a chance.

definitions.definition: ( philosophy , logic ) According to, from the standpoint of; expressing what must follow, whether accepted or not, if a given premise or system is assumed true.
( snooker ) In a position of being able to pot (a given ball).
examples: All the way around the table, off four cushions, and ... and he's on the black!

definitions.definition: ( mathematics ) Having as identical domain and codomain .
examples: a function on R {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} }

definitions.definition: ( mathematics ) Having V n {\displaystyle V^{n}} as domain and V as codomain , for the specified set V and some integer n .
examples: an operator on Z {\displaystyle \mathbb {Z} }

definitions.definition: ( mathematics ) Generated by.
examples: the free group on four letters

definitions.definition: ( mathematics , uncommon ) Divided by.
examples: Twenty on three.

definitions.definition: ( obsolete or dialect , regional ) Of .
examples: I never seen 'im, and that's the truth on it.

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) At the peril of, or for the safety of.

definitions.definition: Without . (Can we add an example for this sense?)

main_definition: ( UK dialectal , Scotland ) Without . (Can we add an example for this sense?)
